title.narrative: COVID RESPONSE - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Strengthen COVID-19 risk communication and community engagement focusing on the most vulnerable in high-risk communities., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable people have access to safe drinking water, clean environment, and key hygiene/water conservation practices.

participating-org.narrative: ACTED AGENCY FOR TECHNICAL COOPERATION AN DEVELOPMENT

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthen COVID-19 risk communication and community engagement focusing on the most vulnerable in high-risk communities.

description.narrative: With the continuous rise of COVID-19 cases in 2021, UNICEF continued addressing the WASH needs of people living in camps and vulnerable communities through the provision of water and sanitation services, distribution of essential hygiene items and personal protective equipment (PPE), dissemination of risk communication and community engagement (RCCE) messages and leading the humanitarian WASH COVID-19 response. UNICEF has prioritized reaching vulnerable families with essential WASH services and despite constraints on social gathering, innovative ways were found to disseminate important messages by adopting WASH infection prevention and control measures during sessions and using technology and online platforms to reach beneficiaries. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/12/2021
